Description: Rim and floor fragment of East Greek pottery plate. Interior slipped. Hook meander frieze on top of rim; lotus and bud frieze on outside of floor, between broad glaze bands with added red band lined in white. Exterior, red-fired lines on reserved ground. One apparent pre-firing hole.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 221, no. 80)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 112, pl. XXXV, no. 323.6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.782)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5988 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
